title: necrophilic practices in ptolemaic embalming cults
preview: Analyzes historical records of corpse veneration and potential erotic undertones in late Egyptian embalming rituals during the Ptolemaic period.

title: legal responses to bestiality in early roman law
preview: Explores how Roman legal codes like the Lex Scantinia addressed bestiality, and what these laws reveal about Roman moral boundaries.

title: homosexual penetration laws in athenian democracy
preview: Studies legal and social consequences of male homosexual acts in classical Athens, focusing on citizen status, age, and passive/active roles.

title: unit 731 and biological warfare experimentation
preview: Documents the methods and medical atrocities committed by Japan's Unit 731, including vivisection, plague testing, and cold resistance studies.

title: corpse exposure and excarnation in tibetan sky burials
preview: Examines the religious logic behind exposing corpses to scavengers in Tibetan funerary practice and its symbolic relation to impermanence.

title: malleus maleficarum descriptions of sexual demons
preview: Analyzes sections of the Malleus Maleficarum that describe incubi and succubi, with attention to how sexual dreams were framed as demonic assault.

title: 19th century hysteria diagnoses at salpêtrière hospital
preview: Investigates patient case files and photographic records from Jean-Martin Charcot’s clinic to understand how hysteria was staged and classified.

title: clergy abuse coverups in boston archdiocese 1960–2000
preview: A documented timeline of how the Catholic Church in Boston concealed reports of child sexual abuse across four decades through transfers and legal settlements.

title: design and function of the inquisitorial strappado
preview: Describes the construction, usage, and symbolic purpose of the strappado in medieval Christian inquisitions as a tool for forced confession.
